summary:
Radiohead is a popular rock band from England, formed in 1985. The group includes five members: Thom Yorke (lead singer), Jonny and Colin Greenwood (guitarists and bass player), Ed O'Brien, and Philip Selway. They are known for their unique sound and experimental style.

Radiohead's first big hit was the song "Creep" in 1993. Their albums *OK Computer* (1997) and *Kid A* (2000) are considered very important in the music world. The band has won many awards and has sold millions of albums. They are famous for trying new things with their music and have influenced many other artists.
title: Radiohead
